column6: Trends in Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) - Mean : Chart Over Time

column1: Indicator Description: Nitrogen oxides (NOx) which include nitric oxide (NO) and nitrogen dioxide (NO2) are a group of pollutants formed by combusion that can cause damage to lung tissue breathing and respiratory problems as well as contribute to smog and acid rain.

Indicator How Calculated:

Air samples collected at specific NYCCAS monitoring sites along with information about emissions sources were incorporated into a statistical model that predicted pollutant concentrations at all locations in NYC for the specified time period. The results were then assigned to the appropriate NYC neighborhood and averaged. The gaseous pollutants in NYC are measured in units of parts per billion.
Indicator Source(s): New York City Community Air Survey
NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
More information can be found at: http://nyc.gov/health/tracking
